result.execSummary:
The defendant Katrawn Deshawn Lee Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Report for probation by 5 p.m. on 10/26/2022.

miscConds.notes:
Complete a Batterers Intervention program at Alma Center.
Mental health assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.
Comply with any recommended treatment of the agent.
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

No use or possession of firearms.
No contact with victim.
Full time work, school or a combination.

Provide a DNA sample by 5 p.m. on 10/26/2022.
Pay the domestic abuse assessment fee.
Defendant to ay mandatory costs and surcharges including DNA and DV during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant. Any bail on deposit to be returned to the person who posted it.
-Court waives all nonmandatory costs, fees and surcharges.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Katrawn Deshawn Lee Harris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Katrawn Deshawn Lee Harris appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Katrawn Deshawn Lee Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant ordered to serve 90 in the House of Correction, credit of 31 days days time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Report for probation by 5pm on 10/26/2022.
- Complete a batters intervention program at Alma Center
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Comply with any recommended treatment of the agent.
- No use of possession of firearms.
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- No contact with victim.
- Provide a DNA sample by 5pm on 10/26/2022.
- Pay the Domestic Abuse Assessment fee.

- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA and DV) during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.  Any bail on deposit to be returned to the person who posted it.

Defendant advised of appeal rights.

Defendant Katrawn Deshawn Lee Harris appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Katrawn Deshawn Lee Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. 

Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Received and Filed. Amended Plea Addendum
Received and Filed. Jury Instruction - Disorderly Conduct
Received and Filed. Plea Addendum
Received and Filed. Offer
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Due to a scheduling error, Court will reschedule case.  Parties emailed new court date.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing on 10/21 at 3:00 pm, Courthouse Room 501.

Defendant Katrawn Deshawn Lee Harris appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Katrawn Deshawn Lee Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a bail/bond hearing. Defense counsel withdraws his bail motion. Case remains calendared as previously set in Branch 41.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Katrawn Deshawn Lee Harris not in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Katrawn Deshawn Lee Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests bail review hearing and plea and sentencing hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Katrawn Deshawn Lee Harris in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has not received discovery and an offer from the state. Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.
Received and Filed:

Court ordered no contact with MAM
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Katrawn Deshawn Lee Harris in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Katrawn Deshawn Lee Harris in custody.  Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Katrawn Deshawn Lee Harris appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/d9e3cc7f-7791-ec2d-80d3-5bfcdc106eb3  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
